segment.source: Use Software Restriction Policies and AppLocker policies (Windows 10)
segment.target: Use Software Restriction Policies and AppLocker policies (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to use Software Restriction Policies (SRP) and AppLocker policies in the same Windows deployment.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to use Software Restriction Policies (SRP) and AppLocker policies in the same Windows deployment.

segment.source: Use Software Restriction Policies and AppLocker policies
segment.target: Use Software Restriction Policies and AppLocker policies

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to use Software Restriction Policies (SRP) and AppLocker policies in the same Windows deployment.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to use Software Restriction Policies (SRP) and AppLocker policies in the same Windows deployment.

segment.source: Understand the difference between SRP and AppLocker
segment.target: Understand the difference between SRP and AppLocker

segment.source: You might want to deploy application control policies in Windows operating systems earlier than Windows Server 2008 R2 or Windows 7.
segment.target: You might want to deploy application control policies in Windows operating systems earlier than Windows Server 2008 R2 or Windows 7.

segment.source: You can use AppLocker policies only on the supported versions and editions of Windows as listed in Requirements to use AppLocker.
segment.target: You can use AppLocker policies only on the supported versions and editions of Windows as listed in Requirements to use AppLocker.

segment.source: However, you can use SRP on those supported editions of Windows plus Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP.
segment.target: However, you can use SRP on those supported editions of Windows plus Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP.

segment.source: To compare features and functions in SRP and AppLocker so that you can determine when to use each technology to meet your application control objectives, see Determine your application control objectives.
segment.target: To compare features and functions in SRP and AppLocker so that you can determine when to use each technology to meet your application control objectives, see Determine your application control objectives.

segment.source: Use SRP and AppLocker in the same domain
segment.target: Use SRP and AppLocker in the same domain

segment.source: SRP and AppLocker use Group Policy for domain management.
segment.target: SRP and AppLocker use Group Policy for domain management.

segment.source: However, when policies are generated by SRP and AppLocker exist in the same domain, and they are applied through Group Policy, AppLocker policies take precedence over policies generated by SRP on computers that are running an operating system that supports AppLocker.
segment.target: However, when policies are generated by SRP and AppLocker exist in the same domain, and they are applied through Group Policy, AppLocker policies take precedence over policies generated by SRP on computers that are running an operating system that supports AppLocker.

segment.source: For info about how inheritance in Group Policy applies to AppLocker policies and policies generated by SRP, see Understand AppLocker rules and enforcement setting inheritance in Group Policy.
segment.target: For info about how inheritance in Group Policy applies to AppLocker policies and policies generated by SRP, see Understand AppLocker rules and enforcement setting inheritance in Group Policy.

segment.source: Important: As a best practice, use separate Group Policy Objects to implement your SRP and AppLocker policies.
segment.target: Important: As a best practice, use separate Group Policy Objects to implement your SRP and AppLocker policies.

segment.source: To reduce troubleshooting issues, do not combine them in the same GPO.
segment.target: To reduce troubleshooting issues, do not combine them in the same GPO.

segment.source: The following scenario provides an example of how each type of policy would affect a bank teller software app, where the app is deployed on different Windows desktop operating systems and managed by the Tellers GPO.
segment.target: The following scenario provides an example of how each type of policy would affect a bank teller software app, where the app is deployed on different Windows desktop operating systems and managed by the Tellers GPO.

segment.source: Operating system
segment.target: Operating system

segment.source: Tellers GPO with AppLocker policy
segment.target: Tellers GPO with AppLocker policy

segment.target: Tellers GPO with SRP

segment.target: Tellers GPO with AppLocker policy and SRP

segment.source: Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows 8,and Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows 8,and Windows 7

segment.source: AppLocker policies in the GPO are applied, and they supersede any local AppLocker policies.
segment.target: AppLocker policies in the GPO are applied, and they supersede any local AppLocker policies.

segment.source: Local AppLocker policies supersede policies generated by SRP that are applied through the GPO.
segment.target: Local AppLocker policies supersede policies generated by SRP that are applied through the GPO.

segment.source: AppLocker policies in the GPO are applied, and they supersede the policies generated by SRP in the GPO and local AppLocker policies or policies generated by SRP.
segment.target: AppLocker policies in the GPO are applied, and they supersede the policies generated by SRP in the GPO and local AppLocker policies or policies generated by SRP.

segment.source: Windows Vista
segment.target: Windows Vista

segment.source: AppLocker policies are not applied.
segment.target: AppLocker policies are not applied.

segment.source: Policies generated by SRP in the GPO are applied, and they supersede local policies generated by SRP.AppLocker policies are not applied.
segment.target: Policies generated by SRP in the GPO are applied, and they supersede local policies generated by SRP.AppLocker policies are not applied.

segment.source: Policies generated by SRP in the GPO are applied, and they supersede local policies generated by SRP.
segment.target: Policies generated by SRP in the GPO are applied, and they supersede local policies generated by SRP.

segment.source: AppLocker policies not applied.
segment.target: AppLocker policies not applied.

segment.source: Windows XP
segment.target: Windows XP

segment.source: AppLocker policies are not applied.
segment.target: AppLocker policies are not applied.

segment.source: Policies generated by SRP in the GPO are applied, and they supersede local policies generated by SRP.
segment.target: Policies generated by SRP in the GPO are applied, and they supersede local policies generated by SRP.

segment.source: AppLocker policies are not applied.
segment.target: AppLocker policies are not applied.

segment.source: Policies generated by SRP in the GPO are applied, and they supersede local policies generated by SRP.
segment.target: Policies generated by SRP in the GPO are applied, and they supersede local policies generated by SRP.

segment.source: AppLocker policies not applied.
segment.target: AppLocker policies not applied.

segment.source: Note: For info about supported versions and editions of the Windows operating system, see Requirements to use AppLocker.
segment.target: Note: For info about supported versions and editions of the Windows operating system, see Requirements to use AppLocker.

segment.source: Test and validate SRPs and AppLocker policies that are deployed in the same environment
segment.target: Test and validate SRPs and AppLocker policies that are deployed in the same environment

segment.source: Because SRPs and AppLocker policies function differently, they should not be implemented in the same GPO.
segment.target: Because SRPs and AppLocker policies function differently, they should not be implemented in the same GPO.

segment.source: This makes testing the result of the policy straightforward, which is critical to successfully controlling application usage in the organization.
segment.target: This makes testing the result of the policy straightforward, which is critical to successfully controlling application usage in the organization.

segment.source: Configuring a testing and policy distribution system can help you understand the result of a policy.
segment.target: Configuring a testing and policy distribution system can help you understand the result of a policy.

segment.source: The effects of policies generated by SRP and AppLocker policies need to be tested separately and by using different tools.
segment.target: The effects of policies generated by SRP and AppLocker policies need to be tested separately and by using different tools.

segment.source: Step 1: Test the effect of SRPs
segment.target: Step 1: Test the effect of SRPs

segment.source: You can use the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) snap-in to determine the effect of applying SRPs by using GPOs.
segment.target: You can use the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) snap-in to determine the effect of applying SRPs by using GPOs.

segment.source: Step 2: Test the effect of AppLocker policies
segment.target: Step 2: Test the effect of AppLocker policies

segment.source: You can test AppLocker policies by using Windows PowerShell cmdlets.
segment.target: You can test AppLocker policies by using Windows PowerShell cmdlets.

segment.source: For info about investigating the result of a policy, see:
segment.target: For info about investigating the result of a policy, see:

segment.source: Test an AppLocker policy by using Test-AppLockerPolicy
segment.target: Test an AppLocker policy by using Test-AppLockerPolicy

segment.source: Monitor app usage with AppLocker
segment.target: Monitor app usage with AppLocker

segment.source: Another method to use when determining the result of a policy is to set the enforcement mode to Audit only.
segment.target: Another method to use when determining the result of a policy is to set the enforcement mode to Audit only.

segment.source: When the policy is deployed, events will be written to the AppLocker logs as if the policy was enforced.
segment.target: When the policy is deployed, events will be written to the AppLocker logs as if the policy was enforced.

segment.source: For info about using the Audit only mode, see:
segment.target: For info about using the Audit only mode, see:

segment.source: Understand AppLocker enforcement settings
segment.target: Understand AppLocker enforcement settings

segment.source: Configure an AppLocker policy for audit only
segment.target: Configure an AppLocker policy for audit only
